intro: Gyaladenia mac-owaniana, commonly known as the MacOwan's bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine meadows, preferring well-drained, rocky soils. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Gyaladenia mac-owaniana is relatively rare and is found in specific regions of the Himalayas.
